segments.text: This kitchen is a mess, literally.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water is pouring from the sink like a waterfall gone wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's soaking the cabinet doors and pooling on the tiles.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman drying dishes doesn't even glance down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is wet, but she keeps polishing away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Stacks of dishes sit nearby, probably next to get splashed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now, those kids are making it worse with their antics.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is teetering on that unstable stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's rummaging in the cookie jar like it's his personal stash.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Crumbly cookies might fall into the water mess below.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, hand out expectantly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open window lets in fresh air, but it can't clear this sloppiness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand seeing such carelessness everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks clean; why can't the inside be?
segments.speaker: PAR
